poem:
"Beneath the Circus Tent of Politics"

Into the ring of 2024 the jokers strut,
Biden and Trump, their dialogue a weary song.
Clown noses affixed over truths and lies,
Squalor of history repeating like an echo.
Amidst pandemic's grim aftermath, we pivot,
And in the grandstand of democracy,
Each punchline masked with hope,
We yearn for peace beneath the wild circus tent,
Our votes the silent drumroll of anticipation.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Who is running for president in 2024? Biden, Trump and the full list of candidates The 2024 election season is under way, with Donald Trump the lone Republican candidate left seeking to unseat the sitting president, Joe Biden. After the pandemic changed the way Americans campaigned and voted four years ago, and three years after thousands of rioters waged violent protest at the nation’s Capitol to upend the last election’s results, the US will face". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
